title: Does going on holiday make you more stressed?
text:
Does going on holiday make you more stressed? AOL Travel UK 3 hrs ago AOL Travel © Provided by AOL Travel UK Girl is sitting at the beach while sunset Most people go on holiday hoping to get relax and unwind. But new research suggests that almost a quarter of us come back feeling more stressed out than when we set off.
See also: Being bothered by your boss at work is more stressful than bungee jumping
Some 26 per cent of people surveyed for Nationwide Building Society said they took two to three days to unwind – while 23 per cent come back from their getaway feeling more stressed than before.
Aren't holidays meant to relax you? Because this holiday is making me extremely stressed
— Sophie?¿! | Inactive (@stormofbastille) July 30, 2015
i'm on damn holiday i should not feel this stressed
— Isaac. (@unpolar) July 24, 2015
Top of the list of stress-inducing worries were overspending, forgetting something, getting delayed, missing a flight and being covered if something goes wrong.
Neuropsychologist Dr David Lewis, chairman of research consultancy Mindlab International, said: "Holiday stresses often stem from unrealistic expectations of a completely care-free vacation.
"The fact is that worries don't disappear just because you are in the sun; in fact when the mind doesn't have the usual day-to-day challenges and demands to cope with, it typically finds other things to occupy it, such as money worries.
"Taking up activities, learning a few phrases in the local language and exploring the culture are just a few ways to keep your mind busy, helping you unwind more quickly."
I swear I've been more stressed on this holiday than I have been at home lol
— Kira Louise Collins (@kiraa_louisee) July 25, 2015
The survey of 2,000 people from the UK also highlighted a significant difference between men and women, with one in five (20 per cent) men claiming that nothing worried them before a holiday, compared with nine per cent of women.
Which tells us one of two things.
Either men really are less stressed than women – or they're just less honest.
